In separate crashes, what are the odds of that? Poor kid.

I just saw a video of dashcams with several crashes, some people belted and some not. Very shocking, the amount of movement in the unbelted passengers is absolutely shocking. I have been in accidents and I was still amazed at how effective seatbelts are. Not wearing a belt, it's YOU that can injure the belted passengers.

Why, in 2025, do people still refuse to wear seat belts? Do we need more deaths? More tragedies to occur first? What a reckless and stupid choice. And now that child is an orphan.

posts.title: Democratic Rep. Gerry Connolly of Virginia dies after battling cancer
top_comments: Six House Democrats have died in office in the past 13 months. Donald Payne Jr., Sheila Jackson Lee, Bill Pascrell, Sylvester Turner, Rayl Grijalva,  and now Gerry Connolly.
75 years old. He was just a fuckin' kid
You’re kidding. RIP but denying AOC this position for a man with 5 months to live is pure insanity.
[removed]
Damn, I lost a friend to esophageal cancer. She was only 40. She was diagnosed a couple years ago. One day she quit her job, went into hospice, and died less than a week later.
This is the guy they said was a better candidate than AOC, jeez
The person the dem leaders fought tooth and nail to get the position so AOC wouldn’t be it? Just lol

I liked Connolly and thought he was a great guy.

But Democrats need to get a goddamn clue and start acting in a way that matches their rhetoric that democracy is under threat. THREE House Democrats who had cancer and ran for re election died since January while the GOP holds a razor thin majority. Every vote matters for these huge sweeping policy changes the Republicans want to make.

We keep being told “democracy is at stake, don’t criticize Democrats! Why aren’t you talking about Trump instead?” Enough. This is anti-democratic behavior to try to stifle the voices of voters and media that are raising these obvious issues of Democrats clinging to power at the price of the people they serve. 

If you believe in democracy, you need to believe in challenging your own side without sputtering “But Trump!” and “both sidesism”

This just makes me more angry that they made him the ranking Dem on the oversight committee instead of AOC. Dem leadership really needs to pass the torch to the new generation who actually wants to fight, and then get the hell out of their way.
He was actually a pretty decent Congressman, though he probably should've resigned once he got the diagnosis.

posts.title: Revealed: UnitedHealth secretly paid nursing homes to reduce hospital transfers
top_comments: Not shocking the UNH is actively trying to reduce quality of care because they are a company whose sole motivation is to optimize for profit.
That CEO killed a lot more than one person.
Prison. This act had to result in deaths.

To those united nurse employees who spoke out and brought light to this: thank you. Your bravery could have helped save hundreds of lives.

ETA: from the article…
If you are a current or former UnitedHealth or nursing home employee and have information you’d like to share securely with the Guardian about nursing home care, please use a non-work device to call or text investigative reporter George Joseph via the Signal messaging app at 929-486-4865.
Every day is one day closer to this shit stain of a company going down in flames. Hopefully.

This is just downright evil:

> Two current and three former UnitedHealth nurse practitioners told the Guardian that UnitedHealth managers pressed nurse practitioners to persuade Medicare Advantage members to change their “code status” to DNR even when patients had clearly expressed a desire that all available treatments be used to keep them alive.

DNR and DNI are great and everyone should be given the opportunity to register that preference. But it is critical that people choose freely and without pressure or bias from medical staff and that their true wishes are what is reflected in their chart. Otherwise it invites murder via withdrawal of lifesaving medical care.

But he’s a father! They were surprised by the public’s reaction to the CEOs death but this will unlikely get the same coverage despite being way worse than the murder of one man. Torture and suffering orchestrated for share holders is the real crime here.

The fine they are going to pay will surely be a deterrent in the future. Surely.

/s
Is anyone going to do anything about it? Of course not. Punishment is for the poors.
Healthcare for profit should be illegal.

posts.title: Person with measles attended Shakira concert, N.J. health officials say
top_comments: This reads like a Plague Inc. notification lol
Someone in the most contagious phase of measles can infect up to 90% of the people they come into contact with. Insert “This is fine” gif here.
And measles sang "whenever, where ever, we're meant to be together"

New Jersey health officials are warning people who attended Thursday's Shakira concert at MetLife stadium that a concertgoer had the measles. 

The Health Department says **someone who lives out of state attended the concert while infectious**. 

People may have been exposed on May 15 starting around 7:30 p.m. to May 16th at 1 a.m. 

Officials are urging everyone to stay up to date on their vaccines, which is the best protection against the disease. 

Anyone who believes they may have contracted measles is asked to call their health care provider before going to any medical office or emergency department for treatment, so special measures can be taken to prevent the potential of further spread. The virus spreads easily through the air.
We learned absolutely nothing. I lost loved ones for nothing. God I'm so fucking angry.
Microbiologist here: OH GOD

Before the vaccine was available in 1963, nearly every child got measles by age 15. The disease sickened 3 million to 4 million people and led to about 500 deaths and 48,000 hospitalizations every year.

✅ Get vaccinated

✅ Vaccinate your kids

✅ Don't take medical advice from RFK Jr.

roughly 0.25%… all this work to fuck over 0.25%, an already marginalized group.

A trans man recently killed himself at our base after being told he was being kicked out.  He already had transitioned years ago and served honorably for many years.

I can’t imagine what he went through.  Giving your life for this country and then being kicked out for being who you are.  Being told you are getting kicked out of your home, career ended and everything you’ve worked for taken away ended in this result.

This is not an isolated incident at all.  It’s despicable.  The depression the other sailors, his coworkers etc are all experiencing as a result of the death of one of their own.  Nobody wanted him out or thought he shouldn’t be here.  Except this fascist dictator we are living under.

This is why I'm so cynical about the government. Not because we haven't made progress, we absolutely have, but because every governmental entity jumps lock-step to whatever outlook the current administration has. Transgender people willing to put their lives at stake for a country that treats them like filth, and this is how they are repaid for their service. Funny how men who have never served a day in their life think they know what qualities a good servicemember should have.

Bunch of fucking sickos.

posts.title: Hundreds of rural hospitals are at risk of closing, threatening critical care
top_comments: One of the things I also wonder about with these cuts is how many of these rural families have elderly family members in nursing homes that are about to lose coverage that pays for their care?

We the people who voted against this shit storm are stuck fighting to protect the opther people from the people they voted in.  I am pretty sure we are not going to be able to apply any brakes until november 2026
Rural communities voted for this.

*The Center for Healthcare Quality and Payment Reform's report* *found that 742 rural hospitals are at risk of closing, with over 300 of those being classified as being at "immediate risk.*

Medicare and Medicaid payments decrease every year, and with the Medicaid cuts about to hit, this will cut the number of paying patients which will be another heavy load on these hospitals.

Rural hospitals are being squeezed from both directions. Revenue is low because they see especially high numbers of Medicaid/Medicare patients. These programs which pay significantly less than private insurance for the same care -- a [review of the literature](https://www.kff.org/medicare/issue-brief/how-much-more-than-medicare-do-private-insurers-pay-a-review-of-the-literature/) found private insurance pays, on average, almost double the Medicare rate for comparable procedures. In some cases, the Medicare/Medicaid payment falls below the actual cost of delivering care. Rural hospitals are also more often located in states that refused Medicaid expansion through Obamacare, which means patients who carry no insurance whatsoever.

At the same time, these hospitals have higher expenses. Rural hospitals struggle to recruit and retain staff, leading to higher labor costs per-patient. Increasingly, they rely on travel nurses or contract physicians to fill the gaps, both of which are more expensive than their traditional staffing counterparts. They also suffer from higher debt loads, costs from deferred maintenance, and antiquated equipment, all of which raise costs.

Naturally, the planned cuts to government healthcare will exacerbate these problems. But the system was crumbling long before Trump came into office, and will eventually collapse completely without major structural reforms.

It saddens me that non-maga people are getting hurt by this. The cynical part of me feels that rural communities brought this on themselves, and that nothing will change until the situation affects them. My only solace is the hope that through all of this, maybe, just maybe, they'll wake the f up. It's an awful part of human nature. My intuition says things will change as a result, but will go right back to "own the libs" as soon as it's over.
“Somehow Biden is responsible for this”
Low reimbursement rates while Unitedhealth alone made a $90 billion gross profit last year. Single payer is the only fix.
if only there was some way to prevent this type of stuff
Trump doesn't care, he just got a new airplane.

So the IDF has to make sure that roving gangs of *<checks notes>* diplomats don't start going to sensitive areas and chatting up the locals. So they fire some warning shots to show those diplomats who the tough guys are.

Every day I wake up, something makes me hate Israel more and more. 

Absolutely FUCK Israel.

"The Israeli Defense Forces claimed the group had entered a restricted area without authorization. No injuries were reported."

So their solution to address who they knew were unarmed diplomats was to fire live rounds at them?

That's their preferred approach and there's no better alternatives?
I have never seen a country try so hard to be hated
Israel is just intent on isolating itself, isn't it?
This could all stop today if Hamas would just release the hostages. -- r/worldnews probably
Everytime that I thought that this country’s brand can’t go any lower, I get surprised
After all that money spent on Eurovision? What a waste.
Sure. And the bomb that gets dropped on those soldiers from half a mile away is just a warning shot too. What is wrong with people the last few years?
Call it what you want, but shooting near a delegation from 20 countries is a guaranteed way to damage international credibility

posts.title: Colts owner Jim Irsay dead at 65
top_comments: There was a rumor he OD’d in Miami and was flown back to Indy and he wasn’t doing good.

Man, y'all may not know this but he was an absolute amazing person in my interactions

I used to work at the local humane society out of HS.  We had a dog there that had somehow ended up there all the way from SC.  Because no one adopted the dog, it ended up on the news and the family from SC saw the dog and said it was there's.  They didn't have the money to come get the dog, and Irsay heard about it and flew the dog down himself on his private jet.  He sent a picture to us of the dog eating steak on the jet

Nothing but good things to say about Mr Irsay

RIP
65?? Thought the dude was in his 80s....
Addiction is a disease, not a moral failure and I wish our society made that distinction.
He was here for a good time not a long time

Jesus I hope I don’t look like that when I’m 65. 

Also, condolences to his family.
Dibs on the Black Strat
Dude was a party animal and it eventually caught up with him.
Curious what happens with his insane guitar collection and other oddities.
How the hell did he go from GM to owner in 13 years?  Did he already have family money?

posts.title: Former New York state trooper pleads guilty to faking his own shooting
top_comments:
>Donnelly said the ruse was an apparent bid to gain sympathy from a former girlfriend

Well she dodged a bullet.

>Instead, prosecutors say, he staged the scene of the alleged shooting by scattering shell casings, then shot himself at a park, stashed the .22-caliber rifle, drove back to the highway and called for backup.

>Nassau County District Attorney Anne Donnelly said after Wednesday’s hearing that “one of the most disturbing parts” of the case was that he intentionally set in motion a potentially dangerous search.

>Mascia described the fictitious driver as a “dark-skinned” man wearing a balaclava that exposed only his eyes. He also claimed the suspect fled in a car bearing temporary New Jersey plates heading toward New York City.


Disturbing is putting it mildly. He used the familiar “dark-skinned man” trope to shift blame, and risked the lives of anyone in the area fitting the description. The cops would be far more trigger-happy if they thought another cop had been shot.

> “If someone had been stopped that fit the description? Who knows what would have happened?” the district attorney said. “It’s just a frightening thought.”

Yeah, maybe if cops were actually held to standards it would be less terrifying.
The best nickname i can come up with is Justice Smollett, but I think we can do better.
Could have at least paid Bobby Baccala to do the deed
NOPE....The community needs to remember he is a liar

posts.title: Texas Renaissance Festival founder ‘King George’ dies at Todd Mission home
top_comments:
The Ren Faire doc was great - I think it’s easy to mistake it as reality tv but it really does a great job displaying the relationships that all these people had with King George. The greed and betrayal that occurs in a ‘small’ family business, and how far passion actually gets some of them (not far) is really captivating. I was mistaken to think that King George was just a crazy old bat, which he was, but when it came to the financials and operations he was very sharp. Many of the people striving to be his successor weren’t really aware of that fact, and thought once they got in they’d be steering the ship, but were in over their heads. 

I’d recommend people give the documentary a chance as it really takes some crazy turns.

Obligatory King of the Hill: 

King Philip: [in British accent] "Department of Labor, OSHA"
[British accent slowly becoming Texan drawl]

King Philip: "Texas Workforce Commission"?
[full American accent]

King Philip: Crap! I'm gonna lose my Faire. I don't want to go back to selling real estate!
He's up in heaven, paying for escort Angels.
Rest in piss, creepy greedy old narcissist
the king is dead? now the lords of the realm will fight for succession.
weird coincidence, I just watched a documentary on this guy on Monday. RIP
“No suspected danger to the public” 😂

Real curious who his will puts in charge.....  
Dude was a legit lunatic, that will could be WILD.
Damn RIP. Just did my first ren fest there last November it was awesome... The after hours shit is crazy 💀
I am absolutely shocked Texas allows Renaissance Festivals. Seems like the kind of fun Ol’ Popeye Paxton and the other cartoon characters in Texas politics would outlaw.

posts.title: Colts owner Jim Irsay dead at 65
top_comments: There was a rumor he OD’d in Miami and was flown back to Indy and he wasn’t doing good.

Man, y'all may not know this but he was an absolute amazing person in my interactions

I used to work at the local humane society out of HS.  We had a dog there that had somehow ended up there all the way from SC.  Because no one adopted the dog, it ended up on the news and the family from SC saw the dog and said it was there's.  They didn't have the money to come get the dog, and Irsay heard about it and flew the dog down himself on his private jet.  He sent a picture to us of the dog eating steak on the jet

Nothing but good things to say about Mr Irsay

RIP
65?? Thought the dude was in his 80s....
Addiction is a disease, not a moral failure and I wish our society made that distinction.
He was here for a good time not a long time

Also, condolences to his family.

posts.title: Hundreds of rural hospitals are at risk of closing, threatening critical care
top_comments: One of the things I also wonder about with these cuts is how many of these rural families have elderly family members in nursing homes that are about to lose coverage that pays for their care?

We the people who voted against this shit storm are stuck fighting to protect the opther people from the people they voted in.  I am pretty sure we are not going to be able to apply any brakes until november 2026
Rural communities voted for this.

*The Center for Healthcare Quality and Payment Reform's report* *found that 742 rural hospitals are at risk of closing, with over 300 of those being classified as being at "immediate risk.*

Medicare and Medicaid payments decrease every year, and with the Medicaid cuts about to hit, this will cut the number of paying patients which will be another heavy load on these hospitals.

Rural hospitals are being squeezed from both directions. Revenue is low because they see especially high numbers of Medicaid/Medicare patients. These programs which pay significantly less than private insurance for the same care -- a [review of the literature](https://www.kff.org/medicare/issue-brief/how-much-more-than-medicare-do-private-insurers-pay-a-review-of-the-literature/) found private insurance pays, on average, almost double the Medicare rate for comparable procedures. In some cases, the Medicare/Medicaid payment falls below the actual cost of delivering care. Rural hospitals are also more often located in states that refused Medicaid expansion through Obamacare, which means patients who carry no insurance whatsoever.

At the same time, these hospitals have higher expenses. Rural hospitals struggle to recruit and retain staff, leading to higher labor costs per-patient. Increasingly, they rely on travel nurses or contract physicians to fill the gaps, both of which are more expensive than their traditional staffing counterparts. They also suffer from higher debt loads, costs from deferred maintenance, and antiquated equipment, all of which raise costs.

Naturally, the planned cuts to government healthcare will exacerbate these problems. But the system was crumbling long before Trump came into office, and will eventually collapse completely without major structural reforms.

It saddens me that non-maga people are getting hurt by this. The cynical part of me feels that rural communities brought this on themselves, and that nothing will change until the situation affects them. My only solace is the hope that through all of this, maybe, just maybe, they'll wake the f up. It's an awful part of human nature. My intuition says things will change as a result, but will go right back to "own the libs" as soon as it's over.
“Somehow Biden is responsible for this”
Low reimbursement rates while Unitedhealth alone made a $90 billion gross profit last year. Single payer is the only fix.
if only there was some way to prevent this type of stuff
Trump doesn't care, he just got a new airplane.

posts.title: Former New York state trooper pleads guilty to faking his own shooting
top_comments:
>Donnelly said the ruse was an apparent bid to gain sympathy from a former girlfriend

Well she dodged a bullet.

>Instead, prosecutors say, he staged the scene of the alleged shooting by scattering shell casings, then shot himself at a park, stashed the .22-caliber rifle, drove back to the highway and called for backup.

>Nassau County District Attorney Anne Donnelly said after Wednesday’s hearing that “one of the most disturbing parts” of the case was that he intentionally set in motion a potentially dangerous search.

>Mascia described the fictitious driver as a “dark-skinned” man wearing a balaclava that exposed only his eyes. He also claimed the suspect fled in a car bearing temporary New Jersey plates heading toward New York City.


Disturbing is putting it mildly. He used the familiar “dark-skinned man” trope to shift blame, and risked the lives of anyone in the area fitting the description. The cops would be far more trigger-happy if they thought another cop had been shot.

> “If someone had been stopped that fit the description? Who knows what would have happened?” the district attorney said. “It’s just a frightening thought.”

Yeah, maybe if cops were actually held to standards it would be less terrifying.
The best nickname i can come up with is Justice Smollett, but I think we can do better.
Could have at least paid Bobby Baccala to do the deed
NOPE....The community needs to remember he is a liar

New Jersey health officials are warning people who attended Thursday's Shakira concert at MetLife stadium that a concertgoer had the measles.

People may have been exposed on May 15 starting around 7:30 p.m. to May 16th at 1 a.m. 

Officials are urging everyone to stay up to date on their vaccines, which is the best protection against the disease. 

Anyone who believes they may have contracted measles is asked to call their health care provider before going to any medical office or emergency department for treatment, so special measures can be taken to prevent the potential of further spread. The virus spreads easily through the air.

https://usafacts.org/articles/how-many-people-are-in-the-us-military-a-demographic-overview/

roughly 0.25%… all this work to fuck over 0.25%, an already marginalized group.

A trans man recently killed himself at our base after being told he was being kicked out.  He already had transitioned years ago and served honorably for many years.

I can’t imagine what he went through.  Giving your life for this country and then being kicked out for being who you are.  Being told you are getting kicked out of your home, career ended and everything you’ve worked for taken away ended in this result.

This is not an isolated incident at all.  It’s despicable.  The depression the other sailors, his coworkers etc are all experiencing as a result of the death of one of their own.  Nobody wanted him out or thought he shouldn’t be here.  Except this fascist dictator we are living under.

This is why I'm so cynical about the government. Not because we haven't made progress, we absolutely have, but because every governmental entity jumps lock-step to whatever outlook the current administration has.
